meanings.definition: To take away or remove something.
meanings.sent1: She dempt the toy from the child.
meanings.sent2: The teacher dempt the incorrect answer from the board.
meanings.sent3: The magician dempt the rabbit from the hat, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: The storm dempt the sand from the beach, reshaping the coastline.
meanings.sent5: The vacuum cleaner dempt all the dirt from the carpet, making it spotless.

meanings.definition: To deprive or strip of something.
meanings.sent1: The thief dempt the jewels from the safe.
meanings.sent2: The harsh winter dempt the trees of their leaves.
meanings.sent3: The diet dempt all the delicious treats from her daily meals.
meanings.sent4: The cruel ruler dempt the people of their freedom.
meanings.sent5: The flood dempt the town of its usual hustle and bustle.

meanings.definition: To lessen or reduce in value or importance.
meanings.sent1: His careless actions dempt his reputation among his peers.
meanings.sent2: The new law dempt the significance of the old regulations.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected win dempt the opponent's confidence.
meanings.sent4: The discovery of the treasure dempt the value of the old map.
meanings.sent5: The fading colors dempt the beauty of the painting over time.
